verses.verse: Six days later Jesus took Peter, James, and John, his brother, and brought them up on a high mountain alone.
He transformed his appearance in front of them, and his face shone like the sun, and his clothes was as white as its light.
Look! Moses and Elijah appeared to them talking with him.
Then Peter answered and said to Jesus, "Lord it is good for us to be here. If you want, let us make three tents here one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah."
While he was still speaking a bright cloud encircled them, and look, a voice out of the cloud said, "This is my beloved Son in whom I am well pleased. Listen closely to him."
When the disciples heard this, they fell on their faces terrified.
Jesus came and touched them and said, "Get up; do not be afraid."
When they looked up, they saw no man except Jesus only.
As they came down from the mountain Jesus commanded them saying, "Tell no one the vision until the Son of Man is risen from the dead."
His disciples asked him saying, "Then why do the scribes say that Elijah must come first?"
Jesus answered and said to them, "Elijah truly will come first and restore all things.
"But I tell you that Elijah came already, and they didn't recognize him, but they did to him whatsoever they wanted to. In a similar way the Son of Man will also suffer from them."
Then the disciples understood that he spoke to them about John the Baptist.
When they came to the multitude, a man came to him, kneeling down and saying,
"Lord have mercy on my son, for he is a epileptic and suffers greatly, for sometimes he falls into the fire and often into the water.
"I brought him to your disciples, but they could not cure him."
Then Jesus answered and said, "O faithless, corrupt generation, how long will I be with you? How long will I put up with you? Bring him here to me."
Jesus rebuked the devil, and he went out of him. The child was cured from that very moment.
Then the disciples came to Jesus privately and said, "Why couldn't we cast him out?"

Jesus said to them, "Because of your weak faith, for truly I say to you: If you had faith even as a grain of mustard seed, you could say to this mountain, «Go from here to there,» and it would change places. Nothing would be impossible for you.
"Nevertheless this kind doesn't go out except by prayer and fasting."
While they stayed in Galilee, Jesus said to them, "The Son of Man will be betrayed into the hands of men.
"They will kill him, and on the third day he will be raised again." They were very sad.
When they came to Capernaum, those who collected Temple taxes came to Peter and said, "Doesn't your master pay the Temple tax?"
He said, "Yes." When he came into the house, Jesus stopped him saying, "What do you think Simon from whom do the earthly kings take duties and taxes, their own children or those not their own?"
Peter said to him, "From those not their own." Jesus said to him, "Then the children are exempt.

"But lest we offend them, you go to the sea and thrown in a hook. Take up the first fish that comes up. After you have opened its mouth, you will find a piece of money. Take that and give it to them for me and you."
